models package¶

Submodules¶

models.car module¶

car.py

Defines the Car model hierarchy for the car rental system. Includes abstract base class Car and concrete subclasses for different car types (Luxury, Sedan, SUV). Provides a CarFactory for creating car instances based on type.

class models.car.Car(make: str, model: str, year: int, mileage: int, available_now: int, min_rent_period: int, max_rent_period: int, car_type: str, base_rate_per_day: float)¶

Bases: ABC

Abstract base class for car objects in the rental system. Defines common attributes and an abstract method for rate calculation.

available_now: int¶
base_rate_per_day: float¶
abstractmethod calculate_rate(days: int) → float¶

Calculate the rental rate for the given number of days. Must be implemented by subclasses.

car_type: str¶
make: str¶
max_rent_period: int¶
mileage: int¶
min_rent_period: int¶
model: str¶
year: int¶
class models.car.CarFactory¶

Bases: object

Factory class for creating car instances based on car_type string.

static create_car(car_type: str, make: str, model: str, year: int, mileage: int, available_now: int, min_rent_period: int, max_rent_period: int) → Car | None¶

Create a car of the specified type (luxury, sedan, suv). Returns an instance of the appropriate Car subclass or None if type is invalid.

class models.car.LuxuryCar(make: str, model: str, year: int, mileage: int, available_now: int, min_rent_period: int, max_rent_period: int)¶

Bases: Car

Concrete Car subclass for luxury cars with higher rates and custom rate logic.

calculate_rate(days: int) → float¶

Calculate rate for luxury cars. More expensive for shorter rentals.

class models.car.SUVCar(make: str, model: str, year: int, mileage: int, available_now: int, min_rent_period: int, max_rent_period: int)¶

Bases: Car

Concrete Car subclass for SUV cars with balanced rates and custom rate logic.

calculate_rate(days: int) → float¶

Calculate rate for SUVs. Balanced rate structure.

class models.car.SedanCar(make: str, model: str, year: int, mileage: int, available_now: int, min_rent_period: int, max_rent_period: int)¶

Bases: Car

Concrete Car subclass for sedan cars with standard rates and custom rate logic.

calculate_rate(days: int) → float¶

Calculate rate for sedans. Cheaper for longer rentals.

models.rental module¶

rental.py

Defines the Rental model for the car rental system. Represents a rental transaction between a user and a car, including dates, fee, and status.

class models.rental.Rental(user_id: int, car_id: int, start_date: str, end_date: str, total_fee: float, status: str = 'pending')¶

Bases: object

car_id: int¶
end_date: str¶
start_date: str¶
status: str = 'pending'¶
total_fee: float¶
user_id: int¶

models.user module¶

user.py

Defines the User model hierarchy for the car rental system. Includes base User class, AdminUser and CustomerUser subclasses, and a UserFactory for instantiation.

class models.user.AdminUser(id: int, username: str, password: str, email: str)¶

Bases: User

Subclass representing an admin user. Inherits from User and sets role to ‘admin’.

class models.user.CustomerUser(id: int, username: str, password: str, email: str)¶

Bases: User

Subclass representing a customer user. Inherits from User and sets role to ‘customer’.

class models.user.User(id: int, username: str, password: str, email: str, role: str)¶

Bases: object

email: str¶
id: int¶
password: str¶
role: str¶
username: str¶
class models.user.UserFactory¶

Bases: object

Factory class for creating User instances based on role.

static create_user(id: int, username: str, password: str, email: str, role: str) → User¶

Create a User, AdminUser, or CustomerUser instance based on the role.
